levels.title: Why Strong Passwords Matter
levels.content: A strong password protects your accounts from unauthorized access. Attackers use techniques like brute force or dictionary attacks to guess passwords. Simple passwords like '123456' or 'password' are cracked in seconds. Using longer, more complex passwords makes this much harder.

levels.title: Components of a Strong Password
levels.content: Strong passwords use a mix of uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers, and special characters. They avoid common words, personal information, or predictable patterns. A good example: 'T1g3r$R0ck!2024'.

levels.title: Password Managers
levels.content: Remembering strong passwords for every account is hard. Password managers generate and store secure passwords for you. They keep your credentials encrypted and accessible with one master password.
